==== Notes ====
[0] Tested 'live' with Kubuntu 7.04 CD-ROM kernel 2.6.20-15-generic
[1]  PCMCIA controller not listed at KInfoCenter
      PCMCIA controller found by KDE Control Center under Linspire 5.0.347 and supports a hardware modem correctly
      PCMCIA controller not listed at KinfoCenter by Linspire 5.1.437 or Freespire 2.0 either
[2] Winmodem not found by KPPP at /dev/modem
      Winmodem did work under earlier versions of Linspire until zapped by lightning strike
[3] glxinfo aborted causing 'live' session to restart with message:
     "Sorry, the program 'artsd' closed unexpectedly"
[4] Booted and ran Kubuntu CD-ROM correctly
[5] 4 Ports detected incorrectly with USB to RS232 converter cable
     Port 1 (USB 1.10) found at two hardware locations (back bottom & right side front)
     Port 2 (USB 1.10) found at one hardware location (back top)
     Port 3 (USB 1.10) found at one hardware location (right side 2nd place)
     Port 4 (USB 2.00) NOT found
     Note same result under Linspire 5.0.347
